availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
County of Henry
N W G
May 4th 1865
N W G
May 4th 1865

On this 4th day of May 1865 Personally appeared before me a Notary Public for sd county -- Doct James Ireland & W P Thorn -- who being duly sworn certify -- that on the 16th day of January 1865 Thomas Williams & family were boarding at the house of W K Thorn & that on the date above named & before & subsequent to sd date the wife of sd Thomas Williams was sick & afflicted with Jaundice which required medical attention & constant attendance, that her husband was the only person she had to wait on her -- & Deponent (Ireland) states that the facts are fresh in his recollection as he was the attendant Physician of Mrs Williams at the time Deponents state that they are in no way related to sd Williams or family --

Dr Jas. W. Ireland
W P Thorn
Subscribed & sworn to by Doct J W Ireland & W P Thorn before me this 4th day of May 1865 & I also state that I know them to be residents of Henry county Kentucky

N. W. Gould N P
H. C

State of Kentucky
Henry County } Sct

I M. B. Pearce clerk of the Henry County Court certify that the signature as appears above of N. W. Gould is his genuine Signature and that he is and was at the time of signing the Same duly Commission^ed^ as Notary Public of the County and State aforesaid and that full faith and credit can be given to all of his acts as Such. And I farther certify that I am personally acquainted with the above named Dr James. W. Ireland and W. P. Thorn whoes signatures -- appear to the above affidavit and know them to be residents of Henry County Kentucky
Witness my hand as Clerk and seal of said Court this May 5th 1865
